author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: وَصَّى مَنْ فِي الإِمْكانِ بِأَمْرِكَ وَظُهُورِكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ، قَالَ وَقَوْلُهُ الأَحْلى إِيَّاكُمْ أَنْ يَمْنَعَكُمُ البَيانُ وَحُرُوفاتُهُ عَنِ الرَّحْمنِ
translation: And when the world’s horizon was illumined, and He Who is the Most Great Name was manifested, all disbelieved in Him and in His signs, except such as have been carried away by the sweetness of Thy glorification and praise. There befell Him what must remain inscrutable to everyone except Thee, Whose knowledge transcendeth all who are in Thy heaven and all who are on Thy earth.
